meanings.definition: Having two different alleles for a particular gene.
meanings.sent1: The cat was heterozygous for its fur color, showing both black and white patches.
meanings.sent2: The flower displayed a heterozygous trait with petals of different shades of pink.
meanings.sent3: The heterozygous plant seemed to be playing dress-up with its varied leaf colors.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was like a heterozygous garden, full of diverse patterns and colors.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was a heterozygous mix of students, each bringing unique ideas and perspectives.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an individual having two different forms of a particular gene.
meanings.sent1: The heterozygous twins had distinct eye colors, one blue and one brown.
meanings.sent2: In the heterozygous population, some individuals had curly hair while others had straight.
meanings.sent3: The heterozygous siblings looked like a genetic puzzle with their mixed features.
meanings.sent4: His music taste was as heterozygous as his genetic makeup, spanning various genres.
meanings.sent5: The art gallery showcased a heterozygous collection of paintings, from abstract to realism.
